meanings.definition: Counting more than the actual number.
meanings.sent1: The overcount balloons made the party look extra festive.
meanings.sent2: She noticed the overcount candies in the jar and smiled.
meanings.sent3: The overcount cookies were so abundant that they filled the entire table.
meanings.sent4: The overcount stars in the sky seemed to twinkle brighter than usual.
meanings.sent5: The overcount flowers in the garden created a colorful display.

meanings.definition: To exceed the correct number when counting.
meanings.sent1: Please double-check to ensure you don't overcount the inventory.
meanings.sent2: He tends to overcount the steps when climbing stairs.
meanings.sent3: The squirrel seemed to overcount the nuts it buried in the ground.
meanings.sent4: Try not to overcount your blessings; appreciate each one.
meanings.sent5: She would often overcount the money in her piggy bank, hoping for more.
